alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greenbrier; Monroe (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 6:25AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of orthwestern Roanoke and western Alleghany Counties in west central Virginia, northeastern Pulaski, Giles, Craig and northern Montgomery Counties in southwestern Virginia, south central Greenbrier and Monroe Counties in southeastern West Virginia and the City of Radford through 730 AM EDT... At 624 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pearisburg, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Blacksburg... Christiansburg... Radford... Alleghany... Pulaski... Pearisburg... and Dublin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
